name: You're So Paranoid, I Bet You Think This Game Is About You
name_original: You're So Paranoid, I Bet You Think This Game Is About You
description:
In this interactive game you assume the persona of Daniel Schmitt, a co-founder of Wikileaks. You must decide how to handle the Cablegate dilemma: whether or not to publish the diplomatic cables in their entirety, or to continue to partner with major media outlets add publish redacted versions accompanied by articles that analyze their significance. 

Your interlocutors in this are Michel Foucault, and Eve Kosofsky Sedgwick, and their arguments are meant to illuminate Sedgwick's essay, "Paranoid Reading and Reparative Reading, or, You’re So Paranoid, You Probably Think This Essay is About You."
